comments: n/(log(n)-1) is a better approximation than n/log(n) to pi(n) the number of primes <= n, though worse than the logarithmic integral or the Riemann prime number formula
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
C. K. Caldwell, How Many Primes Are There?
prog: (Haskell)a053621 = round . (\x -> x / (log x - 1)) . fromIntegral-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 30 2014
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 21 2000
